sourceDesc.p: Select transcriptions of witness statements at the coroner's inquest, to the police and district attorney's office are drawn from the remarkable work done by Bruce Long and other parties as part of the Taylorology website.
For more information, see Taylorology: http://taylorology.com/

head.title: Witness Statement Provided by Mary Miles Minter

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: How long have you known Mr Taylor?

sp.speaker: Minter:
sp.ab: Since July of 1919 -- yes, that is correct.

sp.speaker: Doran:
sp.ab: He has been your director in pictures, has he?

sp.speaker: Minter:
sp.ab: Did you have occasion to call on him at his residence within the last thirty days prior to his death? -- approximately thirty days?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Just a moment, will you --

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Let me change the question. When was the last time you called on him at his residence?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: On the 23rd of December.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Were you alone at that time or did others accompany you to see him?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: I was alone.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Was any one else there?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: no, not a soul.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Was his valet, the colored man, there, do you know?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Not that I know of.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Prior to that time, was it your habit to call on him at his residence or had it been your habit?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: I couldn't call it a habit, but on several occasions I did call upon him, though never asÂ·1ate as upon this occasion.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Now, on this last occasion, what time of the day or night was it that you called?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: May l tell this in my own way?

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Yes, I would rather have you tell it in your own way, if you will.

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: I am glad to. I am trying to answer as I would in court and 1 don't like to do so.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Just proceed, go ahead and tell it in your own way.

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: I had gone to bed; I hadn't seen Mr Taylor in five months at the time -- three months, I know; three months, and I just got to thinking about it and I decided I couldn't stand it any longer. I was going to go up and tell him "goodbye. I got up and dressed, went down to my grandmother's room and I said, "Mama, I am going over to say 'goodbye' to Mr Taylor," and she advised me not to do it. She said it was too late: "Do you know it is nearly twelve o'clock?" she said. I said, "Yes, sure, but I just must do so," I said, "I realize that this is not the usual thing and I have never been there so late, but I must do so, Mama. I am going to give him a letter in whioh I have told him 'goodbye,"' She said, "All right, then, if you must. I would get up and go with you, but I don't feel well enough," Mama often accompanied me on my trips, which were not very many during the entire time that i knew him. So I went over there and arrived at five minutes to twelve, I am strange about that, I am rather queer about that, I think of the time; every time I was with him I would say, "Well, this time yesterday I didn't see him and today I am with him," and things like that. So I arrived at five minutes to twelve and left at twenty minutes to one, and-- Do you wish me to tell you all that transpired?

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Never mind about that.

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Did your mother go with you? No; Mama is my grandmother.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Your grandmother didn't accompany you?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: No, she did not.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Your chauffeur drove you there?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: No, I drove myself in my little car, little run-about.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: That was December 23rd?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Yes, December 23rd.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: When was the last time you saw him prior to that?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: I couldn't give you the exact date, but I know it was at least three months and a little over; it was over three months.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: See him and meet him, to be with him?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: No; no, indeed. I passed him at Lasky Studio when I go over there. Sometimes I have seen his car go down Western Avenue, but I hadn't seen him to speak to in three months.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: As I understand it, you were sincerely in love with him?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: That is true.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: Did you convey that feeling to him?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Absolutely.

sp.speaker: DORAN:
sp.ab: You told him, did you?

sp.speaker: MINTER:
sp.ab: Absolutely. He loved me; he told me so.
